text: The Homekey program, created in the recently passed state budget, will give California cities and counties $600 million to build on another state initiative that has moved thousands of homeless people into hotel rooms during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/fp53CjUGHS

name: sfchronicle
text: Although cabins, visitor centers and historical sites are shut down, all parking lots, trailheads and campgrounds are open at Mount Tamalpais State Park, making it a top Bay Area staycation option for outdoor travel, writes @StienstraTom. https://t.co/lyvKg3CAT4 https://t.co/9OZqZjJpFA

name: sfchronicle
text: The Chronicle followed Theo and his mother over the course of a year to try to capture, through the experience of a child living on the margins of an affluent community like Berkeley, the intractability of Californiaâ€™s homelessness crisis. https://t.co/qurLRipoEB
